attributes.description:
Bus shuttles will be replacing service in both directions between Ashmont and Mattapan. Van shuttles will service Capen St, Valley Rd, and Central Ave, due to narrow roads in the area. Transfer between bus and van shuttles is available at Central Ave Station. 

All buses and vans are accessible for persons with disabilities.

attributes.description:
Access to the Kendall/MIT Station will remain open and accessible on the Main Street side of the station throughout this construction.
 
The pedestrian plaza between Carleton Street and Main Street in Kendall Square will be closed due to the construction of an underground garage. 
 
Customers are encouraged to utilize alternative paths to/from the station using the paths on Ames Street, Dock Street, or Wadsworth Street.

Affected routes:
Red Line

attributes.description:
The following outbound trains will be replaced by a bus shuttle between Canton Jct. & Stoughton:
- 909 (9:45 am from S. Station)
- 911 (1:20 pm from S. Station), which will be held for approximately 10 minutes between Hyde Park & Route 128.

The following inbound trains will be replaced by a bus shuttle:
- 910 (10:40 am from Stoughton) will be bused between Stoughton & Route 128. The bus will then continue to Dedham Corp. Ctr. for inbound train service aboard Franklin Train 712 (11:31 from Dedham Corp / due at S. Station at 11:54 am).
- 912 (2:15 pm from Stoughton) will be bused between Stoughton & Canton Jct. The bus shuttle will stop at Route 128 for drop-off only & then travel directly to South Station, without making a station stop at Back Bay, and will arrive around 3:30 pm. For inbound train service from Route 128, take Providence Train 822 (2:43 pm from Route 128).

Inbound bus shuttles will depart Stoughton at the scheduled train departure time.
attributes.header: On Mondays, Tuesdays & Wednesdays shuttle buses will continue to replace service on four mid-day Stoughton trains while we test equipment for PTC.

attributes.description:
During MassDOT's construction on the Tobin Bridge and North Washington Street, the Commuter Rail will accept Charlie Cards between Chelsea and North Station (on the Newburyport/Rockport Line) through summer 2019. The trip into North Station is approximately 12 minutes, and trains leave roughly every 30 minutes during peak hours. Schedule for Newburyport/Rockport is available here: https://www.mbta.com/schedules/CR-Newburyport/timetable 

Customers should show their Charlie Card to the conductor or fare inspector when asked. Charlie Cards are available at Haymarket and other major stations between 7 AM and 7 PM (2:30 PM on Sundays at Haymarket). Please see a station agent for assistance or visit https://www.mbta.com/fares/charliecard for details.
attributes.header: Due to construction on the Tobin Bridge & N. Washington St, we anticipate delays to local bus Routes 111, 112, 114, 116, & 117. The Commuter Rail will accept Charlie Cards between Chelsea & North Station to provide alternate service options for customers.
attributes.short_header: Due to construction, we expect delays to bus Rts 111, 112, 114, 116, & 117. Commuter Rail will accept Charlie Cards btwn Chelsea & N Station

attributes.description:
Customers looking to exit the Red Line at Quincy Center should exit at Quincy Adams and utilize shuttle van service to Quincy Center. Customers looking to board at Quincy Center should utilize shuttle van service to Quincy Adams to make Red Line connections. Please see station personnel or utilize a station call box to request assistance. 

The elevator is being taken out of service to be repaired as part of the Wollaston Station Improvements & Quincy Center Garage Demolition Project.

Click here for more information: www.mbta.com/wollaston

attributes.description:
If exiting at Central Square, continue to Kendall Station and utilize free shuttle bus service to Central Square.  The shuttle pick-up location is on Main St. near the station entrance for the Alewife platform.  Please see station personnel or utilize a station call box to request the shuttle.

If boarding at Central Square, utilize free shuttle bus for service to Kendall Station.  The shuttle pick-up location is on Massachusetts Ave. near Elevator 861.  Please see station personnel or utilize the station call box at street-level to request the shuttle.  As an alternative, cross the street and take Elevator 860 to the Alewife-bound platform. Take the Red Line to Harvard Square and switch to an Ashmont-/Braintree-bound train.

attributes.description:
Customers are advised that the pedestrian route for customers transferring from the Green and Orange Line exits at Causeway and Beverly St into North Station Commuter Rail will be moved slightly to accommodate ongoing construction work. 

After crossing Causeway St, pedestrians will use a protected walkway along the east side of Legends Way, directly abutting Portal Park. The walkway will include a barrier and kick-plate for blind and low vision passengers.

As an alternative, customers may consider utilizing the west exit from North Station Commuter Rail due to congestion.
attributes.header: Access to the east entrance of North Station is available through a covered walkway. Legends Way is closed to pedestrian access.
attributes.short_header: Access to the east entrance of North Station is available through a covered walkway. Legends Way is closed to pedestrian access.

attributes.description:
Greenbush Line trains will arrive/depart at Braintree at the time they are normally scheduled to arrive/depart from Quincy Center. 

Middleborough Line trains that normally bypass Braintree will stop there approximately 5 minutes after they regularly are scheduled to arrive/depart Quincy Center. 

Updated departure and arrival times are available at mbta.com/schedules. 

Train and shuttle buses will be free. Passengers will pay for connecting subway service between Boston and North Quincy. Please allow additional time to reach Braintree Station.
attributes.header: Weekends, 9/8 - 10/21, Greenbush, Middleboro & Kingston line trains will originate/terminate at Braintree Stn due to demolition of the Quincy Ctr garage. Riders will connect to Red Line shuttle buses & then subway at N. Quincy for service to S. Station.
attributes.short_header: Weekends, 9/8 - 10/21, trains on the Greenbush, Middleboro & Kingston lines will originate/terminate at Braintree due to demolition work.

attributes.description:
For access to Braintree Station during this closure, travel down to the first floor and use the pedestrian crosswalk to enter the station at the street level.
This closure is due to the South Shore Parking Garages Improvements and Renovations Project. The pedestrian bridge will be replaced by a new garage lobby featuring elevators and stairwells.

Affected routes:
Red Line
210
230
236
Middleborough/Lakeville Line
Kingston/Plymouth Line

attributes.description:
Customers looking to exit the Red Line at Andrew should exit at Broadway and utilize a station call box or see station personnel to request shuttle bus service to Andrew. Shuttle bus pick-up is located on the Dorchester Avenue side of Broadway Station. Customers looking to board at Andrew should utilize shuttle bus service to Broadway to make Red Line connections. 

The elevators are being taken out of service to facilitate a full replacement of the elevator lifts, hydraulics, and electrical systems.
attributes.header: Andrew Elevator 872 (Unpaid lobby to street), Elevator 879 (Ashmont/Braintree platform to paid lobby), and Elevator 880 (Alewife platform to paid lobby) will be out of service from August 27, 2018 through spring 2019 to be replaced.
attributes.short_header: Andrew Elev. 872, Elev. 879, & Elev. 880 will be out of service from Aug 27, 2018 through spring 2019 to be replaced

attributes.description:
Inbound passengers will board a free bus shuttle that will make all stops on the Lowell Line except North Station. The bus will run to Wellington Station on the Orange Line for continued service into Boston. There will be no direct connection to North Station. 

Passengers will need to pay the subway fare at Wellington Station. 

Bus shuttles will depart Wellington at the time the train is regularly scheduled to depart North Station. Outbound passengers will need to allow additional travel time to Wellington Station to connect with the free bus shuttles.
attributes.header: On weekends, July 7 -  December 2018, Lowell Line service in both directions will be replaced with a free bus shuttle connecting passengers to Wellington Station on the Orange Line due to Positive Train Control (PTC) testing.
attributes.short_header: Weekends, July 7 - Dec. 2018, Lowell Line replaced by free bus shuttles to/from Wellington Stn on the Orange Line. Visit mbta.com/lowell

attributes.description:
These shuttles are scheduled to occur every weekend through October 21. This is to allow for work at both Wollaston and Quincy Center stations.

All shuttle bus stops are accessible for persons with disabilities. Regularly scheduled service will resume at the start of service the following Monday.

Work is scheduled to take place on the following weekends: 
Sep 7 - 9 
Sep 14 - 16
Sep 21 - 23
Sep 28 - 30
Oct 5 - 7
Oct 12 - 14
Oct 19 - 21

All bus shuttle stops are accessible for persons with disabilities.

Regularly scheduled train service will resume at the start of service on the following Monday.

Affected stops:
North Quincy
Quincy Center
Quincy Adams
Braintree

For more information: https://www.mbta.com/wollaston

attributes.description:
Wollaston is being transformed into a modern, fully accessible facility, making the entirety of the Red Line 100% accessible. 

Trains bypass Wollaston station traveling between North Quincy and Quincy Center. Shuttle buses run between North Quincy, Wollaston, and Quincy Center stations with the same frequency as the Red Line. Shuttle bus stops are fully accessible. 

423 parking spaces are available at Wollaston Station during the closure. Follow @MBTA for updates. 

Visit www.mbta.com/wollaston for details.
attributes.header: Wollaston Station has closed for renovation. Free bus shuttles run from Wollaston to North Quincy and Quincy Center.
attributes.short_header: Wollaston Station has closed for renovation. Free bus shuttles run from Wollaston to North Quincy and Quincy Center.
